alert.note: Alert for Barber; Comanche (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:28PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Barber and southeastern Comanche Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 828 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Aetna, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Aetna around 845 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
